revised_title: The Role of Blood Fluids in Phagocytosis and Opsonic Power
tldr: The authors investigate the relationship between opsonic power and phagocytosis in human blood, discovering that increased phagocytosis is dependent on the development of opsonins in blood fluids rather than modifications to white blood cells. They also explore the opsonic power of blood in relation to the Staphylococcus pyogenes and the Bacillus of Plague, demonstrating the importance of opsonins in the immune response to bacterial infections.
